results.title: Shane [Edited version]
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film directed by George Stevens. Starring Alan Ladd as the mysterious stranger who assists a family of homesteaders, highlighting the mythology of the Wild West and the image of the American hero.

results.title: A Separate peace. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Larry Peerce, John Knowles, Otto Plaschkes, Robert A. Goldston and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film based on the book of the same name by John Knowles. Depicts Knowles’ moving investigation of the loyalty and betrayal of friendship. Original feature film was produced in 1972.

results.title: My side of the mountain. [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the film based on children’s book by Jean George. Relates the experiences of a 13 year old boy as he learns about survival and independence in a mountain wilderness.

results.title: The Doll's house. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Patrick Garland, Hillard Elkins and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film based on Ibsen’s feminist play of the same name. Set in the 1890’s, it concerns a woman’s attempt to find a role in society for herself apart from those of wife and mother. Stars Claire Bloom, Anthony Hopkins, Denholm Elliott, Anna Massey.

results.title: Bang the drum slowly. - Edited Version.
results.creator_credit: John Hancock, Lois Rosenfield and Maurice Rosenfield
results.brief_description: Edited version of the feature film based on Mark Harris’s classic story of friendship, compassion and death set against a background of major-league baseball. Robert de Niro stars as the baseball hero who discovers that he is dying of leukemia.

results.title: Energy, food and exercise
results.creator_credit: Roger Lupton, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A humorous presentation equating the human body with a machine. Raises issues about the effects of lifestyle on health, bodyweight and fitness. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Puppets go through the steps of building the Australian “dream house” with disastrous results. The second part of the film examines the many legal pitfalls, and suggestions are made for the wise consumer to follow.

results.title: Freestyle and backstroke
results.brief_description: Part of the Competitive swimming series. Studies the underwater action of a team of Olympic swimmers. Demonstrates arm stroke technique, the twobeat kick and sixbeat flutter kick and breathing techniques. Excellent underwater photography. Variation between male and female swimmers.

results.title: Competitive diving : Basic diving skills
results.brief_description: Covers basic skills of springboard and tower diving - approaches, take-offs, and basic dive positions (tuck, pike, straight and entry). No other credits available.

results.title: Water power
results.creator_credit: Robin Ridgway, Graham Smart and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Shows ways in which water wheels operate and generate electricity. Other ways of making use of water power are examined. The film takes an historical approach.
Suitable for secondary level.
